ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This is a very good microeconomics course, but be prepared to be challenged with difficult problem sets and exams. It is not a course where you should seek to get honors, but when where you will definitely learn.
I would recommend this course if you have an interest in economic theory.
I would not recommend the class unless you have to take it for your program, but it is definitely more approachable than the PhD level microecon class.

I would recommend Econ 545 to other students. It provides a solid analytical base for graduates wishing to study microeconomics and is accessible for those who have little background in the subject whilst also challenging those with undergraduate micro experience.
Summary: Introduction to a slightly more advanced level of microeconomics than undergraduate. Would recommend to others, provided the student is well-versed in the previous materials.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I feel as thoughI now have much better knowledge about Economics in general. I would have liked to have learned a bit more about how all of this can be applied - it would have been nice if the professor referred us to relevant studies about how the material related to the field of development and microfinance.
Gained a better understanding of game theory.
I am not in a field that closely related to economics, but I feel that it is useful for me to have a solid knowledge of microeconomics, and the course was helpful in furthering that knowledge.

The course built upon my undergraduate micro classes by providing a more mathematical approach to familiar concepts as well as introducing new theory. It has increased my technical proficiency and analytical economic skill.
